data.author: mrsas
data.content: When are you expecting them to do a fund raise? From Interim Results for the 6 months to 30 June 2025 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £267,715	Monthly burn £44619.16667 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £264,942	Monthly burn 44157 (Audited) Year ended 31 Dec 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £711,875	Monthly burn  59322.91667 CASH AND CASH EQUIVALENTS (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025		£557,986 Placing to Raise £500,000 14 Aug 2025	£500,000 Exercise of Warrants 2nd Oct 2025		£58,575 Total Cash	=	1,116,561 At £60000 cash burn per month		18.60935 months At £45000 cash burn per month		24.81246667 months So from 30 June 2025 they have cash for  about 18 months (late 2026) at £60000 per month and 24 months (Mid 2027) at £45,000 per month. Will they need to raise funds before Northern Zone - Permitting  - Mining Lease Grant? For me this is the single biggest de-risking event. It proves the project can proceed to mining and allows Mega Resources to start work. It would be a company-transforming announcement.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: Naughtygordie I have to agree with you but not only is the footprint getting bigger we have good grades at shallow depth too . With the first batch of results from pre-Christmas drilling including : o  9m @ 1.33 g/t Au from 56m, (NZAC146) o  3m @ 4.39 g/t Au from 45m, (NZAC149) o  3m @ 1.89 g/t Au from 48m, (NZAC150) o  5m @ 1.75 g/t Au from 61m (EOH), (NZAC150) o  4m @ 0.83 g/t Au from 47m, (NZAC151) followed by the second batch of results in the previously undrilled "saddle"  including : o  5m at 3.09 g/t Au from 47m (NZAC152) o  6m at 0.72 g/t Au from 66m (end-of-hole) (NZAC152) o  6m at 0.65 g/t Au from 32m (NZAC153) o  1m at 11.0 g/t Au from 46m (NZAC153) o  8m at 0.62 g/t Au from 32m (NZAC154) o  2m at 1.47 g/t Au from 49m (NZAC155) o  7m at 1.58 g/t Au from 42m (NZAC156) o  2m at 1.32 g/t Au from 44m (NZAC157) Now we await drilling results from a further 16 drillholes due to be received in two batches in coming days . Hence is it a surprise the MM's went fishing for stop loses with Riversgold Ltd (RGL) last night ? With company making news being delivered in every RNS it doesn't surprise me one bit .  So looking forwards to next week might be worth reminding ourselves the MM's will always shake the unresearched , novice traders out before more good news is due . Whilst the experienced will try to buy in as cheaply as possible if the MM's are willing to sell them any .

data.author: WillotheWisp
data.content: Online bulletin boards Bulletin board providers are popular among many private investors – some of whom are incredibly well researched, and some of whom (to put it politely) aren’t. At the lower end of the market, these boards are used to encourage the naïve to buy into a stock. There are many who have multi-IDs who then literally have a conversation with themselves, in an attempt to generate excitement around the stock. Should anyone post a contrasting opinion – they are called out as a ‘shorter’ or a ‘deramper’ and are the subject of abuse. Worse still, the group encourages everyone to ‘report’ the post in an attempt to have the post automatically deleted. This means that anyone viewing the board will only see one positive narrative because the posts that are automatically deleted are not reviewed by anyone. Those who own the bulletin boards don’t care about the actual content of the posts, because they’re not monetising the boards. What they monetise is the volume of traffic on the site, which they then sell in the form of advertisements and impressions. So, while the bulletin boards are free to use, there is almost no point in using them.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Small AIM resource stocks like Oracle Power tend to have high risk and volatility, often driven by newsflow and project milestones rather than steady earnings. They are very different from established companies or index stocks. The company has no current commercial revenue and posted a loss in the first half of 2025, continuing a trend of operating losses. Without cash flow, the business depends on equity financing to fund project work. Oracle Power has increased its share count through warrant exercises. This expanded the total issued share capital dramatically. When a company issues new shares into the market, the value of each existing share can be diluted, and that often puts downward pressure on share price. Market summaries list Oracle Power among one of the larger decliners on AIM on recent trading days. Investors should be cautious and do detailed research before investing

In mining, cash is the fuel for the drill bit. • The Winning Argument: Would you rather own 100% of a company with £0 in the bank and no drills in the ground, or a slightly diluted piece of a company that is actually hitting shallow, high-grade gold intercepts in Kalgoorlie? • The Context: Oracle just expanded its Northern Zone footprint (Jan 2026) and is moving toward production. That "dilution" paid for the drills that just increased the value of the ground we own. 3. You’re Looking at the Rear-View Mirror You cited recent "declines" on AIM. Smart money looks at forward catalysts, not yesterday’s chart noise. • The Pipeline: While you’re worried about last week's price, the company has secured a Mining Licence application for Kalgoorlie and an extension on the Green Hydrogen LOI in Pakistan through May 2026. • The Partnership: We are partnered with Riversgold (ASX:RGL) and State Grid Corporation of China. Bottom Line: You’re describing the nature of the AIM market as if it’s a failure of the company. data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: IgorTheEgor
data.content: Https://www.smh.com.au/business/companies/asx-runners-of-the-week-aus-strategic-osteopore-olympio-and-riversgold-20260123-p5nwli.html ………. Gold is flirting with that magical US$5000 an ounce mark (around A$7300), on track to effectively double in price in little over a year. Our Runners this week carry a distinctly geopolitical flavour, dominated by gold plays and critical minerals names. The ASX is once again paying rapt attention, with juniors and producers alike catching the tailwind from this macro madness. No green dreams here - just hard assets in a world that’s rediscovering their value the old-fashioned way………… RIVERSGOLD LTD (ASX: RGL) Up 109% (1.1c – 2.3c) Rounding out our Runners this week is near-term gold producer Riversgold Limited, which unveiled shallow high-grade gold hits from its Kalgoorlie project, accompanied by a recent strategic $2.15 million capital raising at 1 cent per share. The company struck high-grade gold in 21 holes at its Northern Zone gold development in Western Australia. Drilling intersected the mineralised host porphyry across the north-east, west and east zones, expanding the footprint and lending further weight to the company’s broader gold model. Best intercepts included 8m at 5.81g/t gold from 46m, 7m at 3.48g/t from 48m and 5m at 3.13g/t from 41m. Riversgold says modelling points to a 600m-wide zone of shallow oxide mineralisation sitting above the Northern Zone porphyry system. The good news kept coming. Kalgoorlie development partner MEGA Resources will tip in $1 million via a placement for 100 million shares. Under an agreement signed in September, MEGA will fund the project and provide geological, engineering, project management, mining and haulage services, with profits split 50:50. MEGA will also recycle 10 per cent of its monthly proceeds into expansion-grade control and step-out drilling. Riversgold says it will continue refining its understanding of the Kalgoorlie project ahead of a maiden resource estimate, with MEGA already factoring the latest data into mine planning for a first-half 2026 start.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: China’s investment in Pakistan, mainly known as the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) under the Belt and Road Initiative has slowed and worsened in recent years for a combination of economic, political, security, and strategic reasons. Chinese companies and workers have faced increasing militant attacks and threats in Pakistan, especially in Balochistan and other restive regions. Several high-profile attacks on Chinese engineers and projects have raised the costs and risks of operations, making Beijing more cautious about new commitments. Ongoing political turmoil and governance challenges, including frequent changes in government and policy unpredictability, have undermined investor confidence. This instability makes long-term planning difficult for Chinese firms. Many CPEC projects have been delayed or stalled, with only a portion of the originally planned initiatives completed. This slowdown diminishes momentum and makes Chinese investors hesitant to commit to new phases without clearer returns. As seen evidently, the above points are all relevant to projects like the THAR coal mine and the Green Hydrogen. They have been delayed numerous times already. In summary, China’s investment trajectory in Pakistan has faltered primarily because of rising security risks, political and economic instability in Pakistan. Oracle will still have to financially commit to their parts of the deal even without Chinese support. The only difference now is that the Pakistan energy projects will take longer than anticipated without Chinese technical & financial support, Oracle will still need to fund there share of the pie.

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: A day marked to begin the 2026 drilling campaign to continue expanding the shallow gold footprint . So time wise the Joint Venture is not only ahead of expected timelines but looks to be tackling many issues at the same time with conversion of the tenement to a mining lease continuing along with the Mine Development and Closure Plan (MDCP) and the associated environmental assessments is progressing with Resource WA.. All progressing nicely . Best news of all is ORCP will receive 10% of profits  from an open pit gold mine in the near term with a partner  MEGA more than capable of producing the goods just by having ownership of 20% of the Northern Zone .  It would be hard to find another small cap company in such a favourable spot but there you go to me this is the place to be .

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: mrsas
data.content: When are you expecting them to do a fund raise? From Interim Results for the 6 months to 30 June 2025 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £267,715	Monthly burn £44619.16667 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £264,942	Monthly burn 44157 (Audited) Year ended 31 Dec 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £711,875	Monthly burn  59322.91667 CASH AND CASH EQUIVALENTS (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025		£557,986 Placing to Raise £500,000 14 Aug 2025	£500,000 Exercise of Warrants 2nd Oct 2025		£58,575 Total Cash	=	1,116,561 At £60000 cash burn per month		18.60935 months At £45000 cash burn per month		24.81246667 months So from 30 June 2025 they have cash for  about 18 months (late 2026) at £60000 per month and 24 months (Mid 2027) at £45,000 per month. Will they need to raise funds before Northern Zone - Permitting  - Mining Lease Grant? For me this is the single biggest de-risking event. It proves the project can proceed to mining and allows Mega Resources to start work. It would be a company-transforming announcement.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: WillotheWisp
data.content: Online bulletin boards Bulletin board providers are popular among many private investors – some of whom are incredibly well researched, and some of whom (to put it politely) aren’t. At the lower end of the market, these boards are used to encourage the naïve to buy into a stock. There are many who have multi-IDs who then literally have a conversation with themselves, in an attempt to generate excitement around the stock. Should anyone post a contrasting opinion – they are called out as a ‘shorter’ or a ‘deramper’ and are the subject of abuse. Worse still, the group encourages everyone to ‘report’ the post in an attempt to have the post automatically deleted. This means that anyone viewing the board will only see one positive narrative because the posts that are automatically deleted are not reviewed by anyone. Those who own the bulletin boards don’t care about the actual content of the posts, because they’re not monetising the boards. What they monetise is the volume of traffic on the site, which they then sell in the form of advertisements and impressions. So, while the bulletin boards are free to use, there is almost no point in using them.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Small AIM resource stocks like Oracle Power tend to have high risk and volatility, often driven by newsflow and project milestones rather than steady earnings. They are very different from established companies or index stocks. The company has no current commercial revenue and posted a loss in the first half of 2025, continuing a trend of operating losses. Without cash flow, the business depends on equity financing to fund project work. Oracle Power has increased its share count through warrant exercises. This expanded the total issued share capital dramatically. When a company issues new shares into the market, the value of each existing share can be diluted, and that often puts downward pressure on share price. Market summaries list Oracle Power among one of the larger decliners on AIM on recent trading days. Investors should be cautious and do detailed research before investing

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Small AIM resource stocks like Oracle Power tend to have high risk and volatility, often driven by newsflow and project milestones rather than steady earnings. They are very different from established companies or index stocks. The company has no current commercial revenue and posted a loss in the first half of 2025, continuing a trend of operating losses. Without cash flow, the business depends on equity financing to fund project work. Oracle Power has increased its share count through warrant exercises. This expanded the total issued share capital dramatically. When a company issues new shares into the market, the value of each existing share can be diluted, and that often puts downward pressure on share price. Market summaries list Oracle Power among one of the larger decliners on AIM on recent trading days. Investors should be cautious and do detailed research before investing

data.author: IgorTheEgor
data.content: Https://www.smh.com.au/business/companies/asx-runners-of-the-week-aus-strategic-osteopore-olympio-and-riversgold-20260123-p5nwli.html ………. Gold is flirting with that magical US$5000 an ounce mark (around A$7300), on track to effectively double in price in little over a year. Our Runners this week carry a distinctly geopolitical flavour, dominated by gold plays and critical minerals names. The ASX is once again paying rapt attention, with juniors and producers alike catching the tailwind from this macro madness. No green dreams here - just hard assets in a world that’s rediscovering their value the old-fashioned way………… RIVERSGOLD LTD (ASX: RGL) Up 109% (1.1c – 2.3c) Rounding out our Runners this week is near-term gold producer Riversgold Limited, which unveiled shallow high-grade gold hits from its Kalgoorlie project, accompanied by a recent strategic $2.15 million capital raising at 1 cent per share. The company struck high-grade gold in 21 holes at its Northern Zone gold development in Western Australia. Drilling intersected the mineralised host porphyry across the north-east, west and east zones, expanding the footprint and lending further weight to the company’s broader gold model. Best intercepts included 8m at 5.81g/t gold from 46m, 7m at 3.48g/t from 48m and 5m at 3.13g/t from 41m. Riversgold says modelling points to a 600m-wide zone of shallow oxide mineralisation sitting above the Northern Zone porphyry system. The good news kept coming. Kalgoorlie development partner MEGA Resources will tip in $1 million via a placement for 100 million shares. Under an agreement signed in September, MEGA will fund the project and provide geological, engineering, project management, mining and haulage services, with profits split 50:50. MEGA will also recycle 10 per cent of its monthly proceeds into expansion-grade control and step-out drilling. Riversgold says it will continue refining its understanding of the Kalgoorlie project ahead of a maiden resource estimate, with MEGA already factoring the latest data into mine planning for a first-half 2026 start.

data.author: CoolMax
data.content: Important Milestone for Mega Joining: Why the MEGA / BGR deal matters 🔑 Zero funding risk (huge for AIM) 100% capex + opex funded by MEGA/BGR No dilution No debt No “we need £5m at a discount” RNS For AIM juniors, this is gold dust. Economics: don’t overthink the 50/50 split Yes, Riversgold only keeps 50% of profits. But: They pay nothing upfront They retain 80% ownership They get exposure to cashflow instead of perpetual drilling This is a risk-transfer deal, not a value giveaway. Strategic significance MEGA isn’t a promo partner — they’re an operating contractor They don’t sign deals unless: Mining is technically feasible Grades + strip make sense There’s a realistic path to cashflow This is soft validation that Northern Zone can be mined. How this fits Riversgold’s broader story This agreement: Turns Northern Zone from “exploration asset” → development option Buys Riversgold time and credibility Lets drilling focus on: Grade control Extensions De-risking the wider 600m system Importantly: They are trying to skip the most dilutive phase of junior mining.

data.author: DreamTheater
data.content: Oldsharedog.  September 30 RNS 2025 provides a lot of the key detail (some of that is copied below).  Add to that MEGA have found commercial gold grades in the ground.  ORCP have also stated in a recent RNS that production is likely before the end of 2026.   It all looks very promising: Highlights: · The Northern Zone is owned 80% by ASX listed Riversgold and 20% by Oracle ("Project Owners") as set out in the Earn-in Agreement between the Project Owners in May 2023, with the JV agreement to be documented by 31 December 2025 latest. · Riversgold has signed on the Project Owners behalf, a Right to Mine and Co-Operation Agreement with established WA Goldfields mining services provider MEGA Resources for full project funding, mining, and haulage services at its Northern Zone. · MEGA Resources is a full-service mining contractor that will now be providing all of the funding for the operation, through BGR Pty; MEGA Resources will also provide geological and engineering services and manage project approvals. · Mega Resources has a partnership with mining giant BGR Mining & Infra Limited, which owns BGR Pty, and which will provide funding for mining operations at the Northern Zone. · No upfront funding is required from the Project Owners. · MEGA Resources and BGR will share profits equally (50/50) from operations with the Project Owners. · 10% of monthly profits (funded on a 50/50 basis) will be reinvested back into grade control and step out drilling. · MEGA Resources is aiming to break ground during the first quarter of 2026, subject to the Project Owners gaining all the final tenement permissions, mining approvals and the signing of a binding Ore Purchase Agreement with a third-party processing mill. · The Northern Zone drilling has already identified a gold mineralised porphyry around 600m wide and around 500m deep from diamond drilling[1]. · New Northern Zone drilling programmes are being planned to test extensions of known gold mineralisation. Under the MEGA Resources Agreement, MEGA Resources and BGR Pty will pay for 100% of the costs to develop and mine at the Northern Zone, including paying for all ancillary activities (which incorporates haulage of material to the point of sale, maintenance of haul roads and processing costs). In return for MEGA Resources paying for all of the upfront costs at Northern Zone, any profit generated from this partnership will be split 50%/50% with the Project Owners. In May 2023, Oracle and Riversgold signed an earn-in agreement with and Riversgold immediately embarked on a drilling program with first results announced in August 2023. In February 2025, Riversgold exercised its option to acquire an 80% interest in the Northern Zone with Oracle retaining the remaining 20%. Oracle's holding will remain unchanged with the MEGA Resources Agreement.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: China’s investment in Pakistan, mainly known as the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) under the Belt and Road Initiative has slowed and worsened in recent years for a combination of economic, political, security, and strategic reasons. Chinese companies and workers have faced increasing militant attacks and threats in Pakistan, especially in Balochistan and other restive regions. Several high-profile attacks on Chinese engineers and projects have raised the costs and risks of operations, making Beijing more cautious about new commitments. Ongoing political turmoil and governance challenges, including frequent changes in government and policy unpredictability, have undermined investor confidence. This instability makes long-term planning difficult for Chinese firms. Many CPEC projects have been delayed or stalled, with only a portion of the originally planned initiatives completed. This slowdown diminishes momentum and makes Chinese investors hesitant to commit to new phases without clearer returns. As seen evidently, the above points are all relevant to projects like the THAR coal mine and the Green Hydrogen. They have been delayed numerous times already. In summary, China’s investment trajectory in Pakistan has faltered primarily because of rising security risks, political and economic instability in Pakistan. Oracle will still have to financially commit to their parts of the deal even without Chinese support. The only difference now is that the Pakistan energy projects will take longer than anticipated without Chinese technical & financial support, Oracle will still need to fund there share of the pie.

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: A day marked to begin the 2026 drilling campaign to continue expanding the shallow gold footprint . Not forgetting Naheed Memon, CEO of Oracle, recently commented : "These latest results, the last of our 2025 drilling campaign, are excellent " . Then in the same RNS from only 6 days ago : This drilling will be used by MEGA Resources in their mine planning for our joint plans to start mining in the first half of 2026 . From what previous RNS's indicated the remaining 16 drillhole results from the 2025 drilling campaign were to be issued in two RNS's before the 10th February . So time wise the Joint Venture is not only ahead of expected timelines but looks to be tackling many issues at the same time with conversion of the tenement to a mining lease continuing along with the Mine Development and Closure Plan (MDCP) and the associated environmental assessments is progressing with Resource WA.. All progressing nicely . Best news of all is ORCP will receive 10% of profits  from an open pit gold mine in the near term with a partner  MEGA more than capable of producing the goods just by having ownership of 20% of the Northern Zone .  It would be hard to find another small cap company in such a favourable spot but there you go to me this is the place to be .

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

From Interim Results for the 6 months to 30 June 2025 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £267,715	Monthly burn £44619.16667 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £264,942	Monthly burn 44157 (Audited) Year ended 31 Dec 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £711,875	Monthly burn  59322.91667 CASH AND CASH EQUIVALENTS (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025		£557,986 Placing to Raise £500,000 14 Aug 2025	£500,000 Exercise of Warrants 2nd Oct 2025		£58,575 Total Cash	=	1,116,561 At £60000 cash burn per month		18.60935 months At £45000 cash burn per month		24.81246667 months So from 30 June 2025 they have cash for  about 18 months (late 2026) at £60000 per month and 24 months (Mid 2027) at £45,000 per month. data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: WillotheWisp
data.content: Online bulletin boards Bulletin board providers are popular among many private investors – some of whom are incredibly well researched, and some of whom (to put it politely) aren’t. At the lower end of the market, these boards are used to encourage the naïve to buy into a stock. There are many who have multi-IDs who then literally have a conversation with themselves, in an attempt to generate excitement around the stock. Should anyone post a contrasting opinion – they are called out as a ‘shorter’ or a ‘deramper’ and are the subject of abuse. Worse still, the group encourages everyone to ‘report’ the post in an attempt to have the post automatically deleted. This means that anyone viewing the board will only see one positive narrative because the posts that are automatically deleted are not reviewed by anyone. Those who own the bulletin boards don’t care about the actual content of the posts, because they’re not monetising the boards. What they monetise is the volume of traffic on the site, which they then sell in the form of advertisements and impressions. So, while the bulletin boards are free to use, there is almost no point in using them.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Small AIM resource stocks like Oracle Power tend to have high risk and volatility, often driven by newsflow and project milestones rather than steady earnings. They are very different from established companies or index stocks. The company has no current commercial revenue and posted a loss in the first half of 2025, continuing a trend of operating losses. Without cash flow, the business depends on equity financing to fund project work. Oracle Power has increased its share count through warrant exercises. This expanded the total issued share capital dramatically. When a company issues new shares into the market, the value of each existing share can be diluted, and that often puts downward pressure on share price. Market summaries list Oracle Power among one of the larger decliners on AIM on recent trading days. Investors should be cautious and do detailed research before investing

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.content: Https://www.smh.com.au/business/companies/asx-runners-of-the-week-aus-strategic-osteopore-olympio-and-riversgold-20260123-p5nwli.html ………. Gold is flirting with that magical US$5000 an ounce mark (around A$7300), on track to effectively double in price in little over a year. Our Runners this week carry a distinctly geopolitical flavour, dominated by gold plays and critical minerals names. The ASX is once again paying rapt attention, with juniors and producers alike catching the tailwind from this macro madness. No green dreams here - just hard assets in a world that’s rediscovering their value the old-fashioned way………… RIVERSGOLD LTD (ASX: RGL) Up 109% (1.1c – 2.3c) Rounding out our Runners this week is near-term gold producer Riversgold Limited, which unveiled shallow high-grade gold hits from its Kalgoorlie project, accompanied by a recent strategic $2.15 million capital raising at 1 cent per share. The company struck high-grade gold in 21 holes at its Northern Zone gold development in Western Australia. Drilling intersected the mineralised host porphyry across the north-east, west and east zones, expanding the footprint and lending further weight to the company’s broader gold model. Best intercepts included 8m at 5.81g/t gold from 46m, 7m at 3.48g/t from 48m and 5m at 3.13g/t from 41m. Riversgold says modelling points to a 600m-wide zone of shallow oxide mineralisation sitting above the Northern Zone porphyry system. The good news kept coming. Kalgoorlie development partner MEGA Resources will tip in $1 million via a placement for 100 million shares. Under an agreement signed in September, MEGA will fund the project and provide geological, engineering, project management, mining and haulage services, with profits split 50:50. MEGA will also recycle 10 per cent of its monthly proceeds into expansion-grade control and step-out drilling. Riversgold says it will continue refining its understanding of the Kalgoorlie project ahead of a maiden resource estimate, with MEGA already factoring the latest data into mine planning for a first-half 2026 start.

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: CReas In the 2nd February 2026 RNS , fig 3 shows a cross-section diagram of drills assay result up to April 2025 . Once the 40 additional assay results are fed into the 3D leapfrog software due in coming weeks I'm sure they'll be ready to submit plans to acquire the mining license . In same RNS it does state : This drilling will be used by MEGA Resources in their mine planning for our joint plans to start mining in the first half of 2026. It also states we will continue to make this shallow gold project significantly larger in Q1 and Q2 which ties in with the drill arrival on 10th February 2026 in the Northern Zone . After the updated 3D leapfrog I would expect an RNS outlining how many drillholes Rivergold are going to undertake . I may be well off the mark since MEGA Resources may already have plans using data from the latest assay results along with previous data to fast track the mining license . Much bigger organisation with vastly more experience .

data.author: CReas
data.content: Is there a timeline for when this licence will be granted and announced?

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: CReas With regards to the Northern Zone , mining licence . Significant progress has already been made with the " Kalgoorlie Gold Project - Native Title Agreements Signed " RNS : 23 Dec 2025 . Further to this  progress in the 2nd February 2026 RNS · The Mine Development and Closure Plan (MDCP) and the associated environmental assessments is progressing with Resource WA. Hence to me the mining license is a formality now .

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: Oldsharedog Here's my tuppence Northern Zone Gold Project Co-Operation Agreement , line taken from the RNS 30th Sept 2025 : · MEGA Resources is aiming to break ground during the first quarter of 2026, subject to the Project Owners gaining all the final tenement permissions, mining approvals and the signing of a binding Ore Purchase Agreement with a third-party processing mill. Most recent RNS 2nd February 2026 : This drilling will be used by MEGA Resources in their mine planning for our joint plans to start mining in the first half of 2026. Now the main point for me is the Profit spit : · MEGA Resources and BGR will share profits equally (50/50) from operations with the Project Owners. Equal to , 50% MEGA Resources - 40% Rivergold - 10% ORCP The the next line · 10% of monthly profits (funded on a 50/50 basis) will be reinvested back into grade control and step out drilling. Expanding the mine revenue stream in doing so but look at the cost to each company 5% MEGA Resources 4% Rivergold 1% ORCP Meaning our Northern Zone open pit gold mine is going to expand big time very quickly and whilst ORCP only get 9% of profits generated after the 1% re-investment money is taken away , for an AIM listed company with a Market Cap of approx. £9m that will mean it will either quickly rerate or leave it open to a take over . Either way the Market Cap will fly .

data.author: CoolMax
data.content: Important Milestone for Mega Joining: Why the MEGA / BGR deal matters 🔑 Zero funding risk (huge for AIM) 100% capex + opex funded by MEGA/BGR No dilution No debt No “we need £5m at a discount” RNS For AIM juniors, this is gold dust. Economics: don’t overthink the 50/50 split Yes, Riversgold only keeps 50% of profits. But: They pay nothing upfront They retain 80% ownership They get exposure to cashflow instead of perpetual drilling This is a risk-transfer deal, not a value giveaway. Strategic significance MEGA isn’t a promo partner — they’re an operating contractor They don’t sign deals unless: Mining is technically feasible Grades + strip make sense There’s a realistic path to cashflow This is soft validation that Northern Zone can be mined. How this fits Riversgold’s broader story This agreement: Turns Northern Zone from “exploration asset” → development option Buys Riversgold time and credibility Lets drilling focus on: Grade control Extensions De-risking the wider 600m system Importantly: They are trying to skip the most dilutive phase of junior mining.

data.author: DreamTheater
data.content: Oldsharedog.  September 30 RNS 2025 provides a lot of the key detail (some of that is copied below).  Add to that MEGA have found commercial gold grades in the ground.  ORCP have also stated in a recent RNS that production is likely before the end of 2026.   It all looks very promising: Highlights: · The Northern Zone is owned 80% by ASX listed Riversgold and 20% by Oracle ("Project Owners") as set out in the Earn-in Agreement between the Project Owners in May 2023, with the JV agreement to be documented by 31 December 2025 latest. · Riversgold has signed on the Project Owners behalf, a Right to Mine and Co-Operation Agreement with established WA Goldfields mining services provider MEGA Resources for full project funding, mining, and haulage services at its Northern Zone. · MEGA Resources is a full-service mining contractor that will now be providing all of the funding for the operation, through BGR Pty; MEGA Resources will also provide geological and engineering services and manage project approvals. · Mega Resources has a partnership with mining giant BGR Mining & Infra Limited, which owns BGR Pty, and which will provide funding for mining operations at the Northern Zone. · No upfront funding is required from the Project Owners. · MEGA Resources and BGR will share profits equally (50/50) from operations with the Project Owners. · 10% of monthly profits (funded on a 50/50 basis) will be reinvested back into grade control and step out drilling. · MEGA Resources is aiming to break ground during the first quarter of 2026, subject to the Project Owners gaining all the final tenement permissions, mining approvals and the signing of a binding Ore Purchase Agreement with a third-party processing mill. · The Northern Zone drilling has already identified a gold mineralised porphyry around 600m wide and around 500m deep from diamond drilling[1]. · New Northern Zone drilling programmes are being planned to test extensions of known gold mineralisation. Under the MEGA Resources Agreement, MEGA Resources and BGR Pty will pay for 100% of the costs to develop and mine at the Northern Zone, including paying for all ancillary activities (which incorporates haulage of material to the point of sale, maintenance of haul roads and processing costs). In return for MEGA Resources paying for all of the upfront costs at Northern Zone, any profit generated from this partnership will be split 50%/50% with the Project Owners. In May 2023, Oracle and Riversgold signed an earn-in agreement with and Riversgold immediately embarked on a drilling program with first results announced in August 2023. In February 2025, Riversgold exercised its option to acquire an 80% interest in the Northern Zone with Oracle retaining the remaining 20%. Oracle's holding will remain unchanged with the MEGA Resources Agreement.

data.content: Another reassuring day for those that are invested especially with the planned arrival of the drill rig tomorrow for the start of the 2026 drilling program . I'm sure the area to be drilled or further drilled is known by the BOD by now hence I'm expecting an RNS over the coming days to explaining this . As for the compilation of the 2025 assay results along with all other known data for the Northeastern area I feel we'll have to wait for the Leapfrog model to be updated in the next couple of weeks to truly appreciate all the drilling work done in this area . I'm sure the updated Leapfrog model will also be used to speed up the mining license application and get the ball rolling for mining . data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: China’s investment in Pakistan, mainly known as the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) under the Belt and Road Initiative has slowed and worsened in recent years for a combination of economic, political, security, and strategic reasons. Chinese companies and workers have faced increasing militant attacks and threats in Pakistan, especially in Balochistan and other restive regions. Several high-profile attacks on Chinese engineers and projects have raised the costs and risks of operations, making Beijing more cautious about new commitments. Ongoing political turmoil and governance challenges, including frequent changes in government and policy unpredictability, have undermined investor confidence. This instability makes long-term planning difficult for Chinese firms. Many CPEC projects have been delayed or stalled, with only a portion of the originally planned initiatives completed. This slowdown diminishes momentum and makes Chinese investors hesitant to commit to new phases without clearer returns. As seen evidently, the above points are all relevant to projects like the THAR coal mine and the Green Hydrogen. They have been delayed numerous times already. In summary, China’s investment trajectory in Pakistan has faltered primarily because of rising security risks, political and economic instability in Pakistan. Oracle will still have to financially commit to their parts of the deal even without Chinese support. The only difference now is that the Pakistan energy projects will take longer than anticipated without Chinese technical & financial support, Oracle will still need to fund there share of the pie.

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: A day marked to begin the 2026 drilling campaign to continue expanding the shallow gold footprint . Not forgetting Naheed Memon, CEO of Oracle, recently commented : "These latest results, the last of our 2025 drilling campaign, are excellent " . Then in the same RNS from only 6 days ago : This drilling will be used by MEGA Resources in their mine planning for our joint plans to start mining in the first half of 2026 . From what previous RNS's indicated the remaining 16 drillhole results from the 2025 drilling campaign were to be issued in two RNS's before the 10th February . So time wise the Joint Venture is not only ahead of expected timelines but looks to be tackling many issues at the same time with conversion of the tenement to a mining lease continuing along with the Mine Development and Closure Plan (MDCP) and the associated environmental assessments is progressing with Resource WA.. All progressing nicely . Best news of all is ORCP will receive 10% of profits  from an open pit gold mine in the near term with a partner  MEGA more than capable of producing the goods just by having ownership of 20% of the Northern Zone .  It would be hard to find another small cap company in such a favourable spot but there you go to me this is the place to be .

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: mrsas
data.content: When are you expecting them to do a fund raise? From Interim Results for the 6 months to 30 June 2025 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £267,715	Monthly burn £44619.16667 (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £264,942	Monthly burn 44157 (Audited) Year ended 31 Dec 2024	LOSS FOR THE PERIOD	Loss for period £711,875	Monthly burn  59322.91667 CASH AND CASH EQUIVALENTS (Unaudited) 6 Months to 30 June 2025		£557,986 Placing to Raise £500,000 14 Aug 2025	£500,000 Exercise of Warrants 2nd Oct 2025		£58,575 Total Cash	=	1,116,561 At £60000 cash burn per month		18.60935 months At £45000 cash burn per month		24.81246667 months So from 30 June 2025 they have cash for  about 18 months (late 2026) at £60000 per month and 24 months (Mid 2027) at £45,000 per month. Will they need to raise funds before Northern Zone - Permitting  - Mining Lease Grant? For me this is the single biggest de-risking event. It proves the project can proceed to mining and allows Mega Resources to start work. It would be a company-transforming announcement.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.author: aGoldBug
data.content: Naughtygordie I have to agree with you but not only is the footprint getting bigger we have good grades at shallow depth too . data.author: WillotheWisp
data.content: Online bulletin boards Bulletin board providers are popular among many private investors – some of whom are incredibly well researched, and some of whom (to put it politely) aren’t. At the lower end of the market, these boards are used to encourage the naïve to buy into a stock. There are many who have multi-IDs who then literally have a conversation with themselves, in an attempt to generate excitement around the stock. Should anyone post a contrasting opinion – they are called out as a ‘shorter’ or a ‘deramper’ and are the subject of abuse. Worse still, the group encourages everyone to ‘report’ the post in an attempt to have the post automatically deleted. This means that anyone viewing the board will only see one positive narrative because the posts that are automatically deleted are not reviewed by anyone. Those who own the bulletin boards don’t care about the actual content of the posts, because they’re not monetising the boards. What they monetise is the volume of traffic on the site, which they then sell in the form of advertisements and impressions. So, while the bulletin boards are free to use, there is almost no point in using them.

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Small AIM resource stocks like Oracle Power tend to have high risk and volatility, often driven by newsflow and project milestones rather than steady earnings. They are very different from established companies or index stocks. The company has no current commercial revenue and posted a loss in the first half of 2025, continuing a trend of operating losses. Without cash flow, the business depends on equity financing to fund project work. Oracle Power has increased its share count through warrant exercises. This expanded the total issued share capital dramatically. When a company issues new shares into the market, the value of each existing share can be diluted, and that often puts downward pressure on share price. Market summaries list Oracle Power among one of the larger decliners on AIM on recent trading days. Investors should be cautious and do detailed research before investing

data.author: StockMaiden
data.content: Many people have been sucked into the hype without knowing what the company is about, and now, they are feeling agitated, and not accepting responsibility for their own investment decisions. People dismissed a lot of information because it WASN'T what they wanted to hear, and now, they themselves need to hold accountable for their investment. Here's a recap of the company: The split: Strictly speaking, it's 80/20 split between Riversgold and Oracle. Then it's another 50/50 split from the 20% between Oracle and Mega. So Oracle will only receive 10% of whatever potential find. Oracle projects & running costs: Oracle stated that the initial phase of the Thar Block VI coal and power development carried a gross project cost of about US$1.6 billion. For the Green Hydrogen project, total cost is projected at about US$2 billion. There's also the Blue Rock Valley project and other company expenses to pay. Potential revenue Vs expenses: The Northern Zone has a best case scenario of £600 million POTENTIAL. Oracle's expenses is absolute, and as announced the Thar project alone will require $1.6billion. The Northern Zone 10% simply isn't going to cut it for Oracle in the long run. Their expenses greatly exceeds any potential income. The fundamentals: 15billion shares issued speaks for itself. Last checked Oracle only has about £500K and this was in June 2025. Administrative expenses for 6 months is approx £280K. We are approaching February 2026, it means that Oracle has only approx £200K left in the bank. Any potential revenue from Northern Zone won't happen immediately whereas the urgency for Oracle to raise will. It's clear as day what will happen next.

data.content: Small AIM resource stocks like Oracle Power tend to have high risk and volatility, often driven by newsflow and project milestones rather than steady earnings. They are very different from established companies or index stocks. The company has no current commercial revenue and posted a loss in the first half of 2025, continuing a trend of operating losses. Without cash flow, the business depends on equity financing to fund project work. Oracle Power has increased its share count through warrant exercises. This expanded the total issued share capital dramatically. When a company issues new shares into the market, the value of each existing share can be diluted, and that often puts downward pressure on share price. Market summaries list Oracle Power among one of the larger decliners on AIM on recent trading days. Investors should be cautious and do detailed research before investing

data.author: IgorTheEgor
data.content: Https://www.smh.com.au/business/companies/asx-runners-of-the-week-aus-strategic-osteopore-olympio-and-riversgold-20260123-p5nwli.html ………. Gold is flirting with that magical US$5000 an ounce mark (around A$7300), on track to effectively double in price in little over a year. Our Runners this week carry a distinctly geopolitical flavour, dominated by gold plays and critical minerals names. The ASX is once again paying rapt attention, with juniors and producers alike catching the tailwind from this macro madness. No green dreams here - just hard assets in a world that’s rediscovering their value the old-fashioned way………… RIVERSGOLD LTD (ASX: RGL) Up 109% (1.1c – 2.3c) Rounding out our Runners this week is near-term gold producer Riversgold Limited, which unveiled shallow high-grade gold hits from its Kalgoorlie project, accompanied by a recent strategic $2.15 million capital raising at 1 cent per share. The company struck high-grade gold in 21 holes at its Northern Zone gold development in Western Australia. Drilling intersected the mineralised host porphyry across the north-east, west and east zones, expanding the footprint and lending further weight to the company’s broader gold model. Best intercepts included 8m at 5.81g/t gold from 46m, 7m at 3.48g/t from 48m and 5m at 3.13g/t from 41m. Riversgold says modelling points to a 600m-wide zone of shallow oxide mineralisation sitting above the Northern Zone porphyry system. The good news kept coming. Kalgoorlie development partner MEGA Resources will tip in $1 million via a placement for 100 million shares. Under an agreement signed in September, MEGA will fund the project and provide geological, engineering, project management, mining and haulage services, with profits split 50:50. MEGA will also recycle 10 per cent of its monthly proceeds into expansion-grade control and step-out drilling. Riversgold says it will continue refining its understanding of the Kalgoorlie project ahead of a maiden resource estimate, with MEGA already factoring the latest data into mine planning for a first-half 2026 start.

company_30s.what_they_do: ORCP.L is a junior gold exploration company focused on drilling and assaying gold deposits in Western Australia.
company_30s.why_they_matter: It aims to add new gold resources to the highly competitive Kalgoorlie region, which could boost shareholder value if a viable deposit is confirmed.
company_30s.current_state: The company is currently in a pre-revenue, exploration‑only phase, having recently raised £500k through a placement but still awaiting a definitive mineable resource.

rns_narrative: Exploration results: Over the past year ORCP announced a string of positive drilling outcomes from the Kalgoorlie and Northern Zone projects, expanding the footprint and confirming high‑grade gold zones.
Fundraise and dilution: A £500k placement was executed to shore up working capital, accompanied by warrant exercises that may dilute existing shareholders if the company cannot generate cash flow.
Corporate updates: The company released interim financials and a series of operational updates, but no revenue has been reported and no upcoming earnings dates are disclosed.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community remains largely silent; there are no social posts to indicate a consensus, but the few traders who follow the stock are cautiously optimistic about the drilling results.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Bulls point to the consistent gold assay data and the strategic location near the Kalgoorlie gold belt, arguing that a resource estimate could unlock significant upside.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears warn that the company’s price has collapsed 80% from its peak, the placement has raised concerns about dilution, and there is no clear path to revenue or a mineable resource.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The sentiment has stayed flat; there was no noticeable spike in chatter when the drilling results were announced, suggesting the market has not yet absorbed the news.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows a flat, almost negligible search interest in ORCP over the last 12 months, and no social media volume to back the narrative. The story has not generated external traction, indicating that the market has not yet taken notice of the drilling results.

near_term_catalysts: Next quarterly results (Q3 2026): If the company can publish a preliminary resource estimate or a first revenue print, it could validate the exploration narrative and attract new capital.
Upcoming AGM (Oct 2026): The AGM could provide a strategy update, potential dilution vote, or a new funding round, all of which are critical to the company’s future direction.
expect_next.watch_for: Monitor for any signs of a formal resource definition, a mine plan, or a third‑party acquisition interest. Also keep an eye on the company’s share price for any sudden movement that could indicate insider activity or a new funding round.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX scores indicate a ‘Late’ regime: the stock has been in decline for a long period, technicals show no volatility, and the market has not yet responded to the recent news. Entry timing is risky and would require a clear catalyst.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company can confirm a viable gold deposit and secure a mine plan within the next 3–6 months, the stock could rally sharply, especially if a new funding round is announced to cover development costs.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The company’s price has collapsed 80% from its peak, there is no revenue or cash flow, and the only recent capital raise involved dilution. Without a clear resource or revenue, the stock is likely to remain stagnant or continue declining.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk with low upside; potential for a 2–3x return if a resource is announced, but the probability of such a catalyst is currently low.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter a small position (2–3% of the portfolio) if a resource estimate or mine plan is announced. Use a tight stop at 5p below the placement price to limit downside.
playbook.if_watching: Wait for the Q3 2026 results or a clear resource announcement. If the company publishes a preliminary resource or secures additional capital, consider adding on a dip.
playbook.if_passing: Given the lack of buzz, flat Google Trends, and the 80% price decline, it is prudent to stay out of this stock until a major catalyst materialises.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass for now – the story has not generated market interest, the technicals are weak, and no imminent catalyst is on the horizon. A speculative buy would be a high‑risk, low‑reward play.
